item.title: A truffle for 1545535209628
item.description:
Comment: Don't know why, but yesterday I had a thought that I should see if there's a way to listen to shortwave radio online. I found one! I can't explain it, but there's something reassuring about being able to hear broadcasts from around the world that are literally shaped by geography itself.

Link: http://websdr.org

item.title: A truffle for 1545341780142
item.description: Comment: I'm on a crazy one-person mission to get everyone using RSS feeds again!

item.title: A truffle for 1545076507538
item.description: Comment: We need a Queer Church Finder for LGBTQ people and allies. Something like Church Clarity, but with people who will show you around their church.

item.title: A truffle for 1544710811390
item.description:
Idea: What if we got rid of college majors and did a 2-year Liberal Arts degree?

Idea parts:

  • Everyone gets a degree in Liberal Arts
  • There's still room for a Minor
  • Once you finish your degree + minor, you do a paid internship/apprenticeship
  • If your internship goes well but you want/need more education in that field, you work part time and go to school part time
  • If your internship goes poorly or you decide the field isn't for you, you can get another minor and try again
  • If your internship goes well and you don't need more education in the field, you can get a full-time job

item.title: A truffle for 1544630449480
item.description:
Idea: What if the USPS got into the email business?

Idea parts:

  • Everyone in the country gets an email address
  • These email accounts can only send/receive from other USPS email accounts (no spam)
  • Could give to all utilities, official entities, etc... for electronic delivery
  • Could manage account at physical post office in the event of a security issue
  • Could print messages for people who don't want online delivery
  • Could also send money if USPS gets into banking

item.title: A truffle for 1543454122877
item.description:
Comment: Wondering if this would be a good fit for my message server idea.

Protocol: XMPP

Pros:

  • Widely established protocol
  • Reference implementations are available

Cons:

  • Might be too heavy for what I want
  • Unknown learning curve
